---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>stylelint/stylelint (stylelint)</summary>

###
[`v15.11.0`](https://togithub.com/stylelint/stylelint/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#15110)

[Compare
Source](https://togithub.com/stylelint/stylelint/compare/15.10.3...15.11.0)

- Added: `ignoreRules` to `max-nesting-depth`
([#​7215](https://togithub.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/7215))
([@​mattxwang](https://togithub.com/mattxwang)).
- Fixed: `declaration-block-no-redundant-longhand-properties` autofix
for `grid-template` with `repeat()`
([#​7230](https://togithub.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/7230))
([@​mattxwang](https://togithub.com/mattxwang)).
- Fixed: `declaration-block-no-redundant-longhand-properties` false
negative for `font-synthesis`
([#​7214](https://togithub.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/7214))
([@​mattxwang](https://togithub.com/mattxwang)).
- Fixed: `declaration-block-no-redundant-longhand-properties` false
negatives for `*-block` and `*-inline` logical properties
([#​7208](https://togithub.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/7208))
([@​mattxwang](https://togithub.com/mattxwang)).
- Fixed: `declaration-block-no-redundant-longhand-properties` false
negatives for `overflow`, `overscroll-behavior`, `scroll-margin`,
`scroll-padding`, and new Box Alignment shorthands
([#​7213](https://togithub.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/7213))
([@​mattxwang](https://togithub.com/mattxwang)).
- Fixed: `function-no-unknown` false positives for `light-dark`,
`linear` and `xywh`
([#​7242](https://togithub.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/7242))
([@​mattxwang](https://togithub.com/mattxwang)).

</details>

##### Enhancements

- `ProgressBar`: use text color to ensure enough contrast against
background
([#​55285](https://togithub.com/WordPress/gutenberg/pull/55285)).
- `Notice`: Remove margins from `Notice` component
([#​54800](https://togithub.com/WordPress/gutenberg/pull/54800)).
- Allow using CSS level 4 viewport-relative units
([54415](https://togithub.com/WordPress/gutenberg/pull/54415))
- `ToolsPanel`: do not apply the `className` to prop to `ToolsPanelItem`
components when rendered as placeholders
([#​55207](https://togithub.com/WordPress/gutenberg/pull/55207)).
- `GradientPicker`: remove overflow styles and padding from
`ColorPicker` popovers
([#​55265](https://togithub.com/WordPress/gutenberg/pull/55265)).
- `Tabs`: Expose via private APIs
([#​55327](https://togithub.com/WordPress/gutenberg/pull/55327)).
- `ColorPalette`/`ToggleGroupControl/ToggleGroupControlOptionBase`: add
`type="button"` attribute to native `<button>`s
([#​55125](https://togithub.com/WordPress/gutenberg/pull/55125)).

##### Bug Fix

- Render a "mouse event trap" when using a `ColorPicker` inside a
`Popover` to prevent issues when rendering on top of `iframes`
([#​55149](https://togithub.com/WordPress/gutenberg/pull/55149)).
- `Modal`: fix closing when contained iframe is focused
([#​51602](https://togithub.com/WordPress/gutenberg/pull/51602)).

##### Internal

- `ConfirmDialog`: Migrate to TypeScript.
([#​54954](https://togithub.com/WordPress/gutenberg/pull/54954)).

##### New Features

- `Toolbar`: add new `variant` prop for 'unstyled' option
([#​55139](https://togithub.com/WordPress/gutenberg/pull/55139)).

</details>

issue.title: SelectRenderer not scrolling to the selected option
issue.body:
### Current behavior

When using a function to render the items such as `Group` and `ComboboxItem`, the `SelectRenderer` is not able to properly scroll to the selected option.

### Steps to reproduce the bug

1. Open the sandbox using this URL: https://stackblitz.com/edit/fw8mei?file=select-combobox-virtualized%2Findex.tsx.
2. Choose an option which is not visible by default, such as `Mexico`.
3. Click on `Select`. The search input will show the value `Mexico`.
4. Close the `Popover`.
5. Open the `Select` again. This time, the search input will have no value (which is expected) but the `SelectRenderer` will not scroll to the selected option.
6. Close the `Popover`.
7. Open the `Select` for the third time to see it properly scroll to the selected option.

### Expected behavior

This implementation should work just as the [default example](https://ariakit.org/examples/select-combobox-virtualized)

### Workaround

I wasn't able to find a workaround that properly works.

### Possible solutions

_No response_

comment.body:
It's likely due to the items' size being calculated in real time. This aspect still requires some improvement in the Renderer components.

If your items are of a fixed size, you can provide an `itemSize` property to the group items. The official example does this as well.

issue.title: SelectRenderer not scrolling to the selected option
issue.body:
### Current behavior

When using a function to render the items such as `Group` and `ComboboxItem`, the `SelectRenderer` is not able to properly scroll to the selected option.

### Steps to reproduce the bug

1. Open the sandbox using this URL: https://stackblitz.com/edit/fw8mei?file=select-combobox-virtualized%2Findex.tsx.
2. Choose an option which is not visible by default, such as `Mexico`.
3. Click on `Select`. The search input will show the value `Mexico`.
4. Close the `Popover`.
5. Open the `Select` again. This time, the search input will have no value (which is expected) but the `SelectRenderer` will not scroll to the selected option.
6. Close the `Popover`.
7. Open the `Select` for the third time to see it properly scroll to the selected option.

### Expected behavior

This implementation should work just as the [default example](https://ariakit.org/examples/select-combobox-virtualized)

### Workaround

I wasn't able to find a workaround that properly works.

### Possible solutions

_No response_

comment.body:
Hey @diegohaz, I would like to thank you for your prompt reply, and I apologize for the delayed response regarding this issue.

Although the proposed solution worked perfectly for the example, I encountered some difficulties when trying to implement it in my project. Unfortunately, the scroll issue persisted, despite my efforts to replicate the solution.

To address this, I spent some time comparing my code with the example and identifying any small details that may have caused the issue. I [recreated the example](https://stackblitz.com/edit/fw8mei-phkhs5?file=select-combobox-virtualized/index.tsx) using the same items as in my project and only rendered the `SelectPopover` when `mounted`.

As you can see in the video, the scroll issue happens whenever I open the `Select`, never scrolling property to the item.

https://github.com/ariakit/ariakit/assets/23644327/af111adb-063d-4584-ba18-19d1b81d0895

It's worth mentioning that if I stop rendering conditionally the `SelectPopover` it does gets better after a few renders.

Successfully deployed to the following URLs:

## ariakit – ./
